enhancements: Temporal attention mechanism for small objects

key_findings: Temporal attention mechanisms failed in event-based context
Event-density adaptive processing did not improve small object detection
Confirms complexity paradox: simpler approaches outperform sophisticated ones
Small object mAP dropped from 17.28% to 5.4% (-68.7% relative decrease)

primary_causes: Overfitting due to increased model complexity
Inappropriate attention mechanisms for sparse event data
Temporal modeling interference with spatial feature extraction
Enhancement parameters not suitable for 640x360 resolution
lessons_learned: Minimal parameter additions can cause severe performance degradation
Event-based data requires fundamentally different enhancement strategies
Attention mechanisms need careful design for temporal event sequences
Resolution constraints limit effectiveness of feature enhancement

recommendations.long_term: Pursue data-centric improvements over architecture changes
